newsitem.title: CANADA: CWB details primary elevator space, railcar unload.
newsitem.headline: CWB details primary elevator space, railcar unload.

text.p: Primary elevator space across Canada's Prairies averaged 23 percent vacant in the week ended November 11, the Canadian Wheat Board said.
Alberta elevators showed 30 percent space vacant, Saskatchewan elevators were 20 percent vacant, and Manitoba elevators were 17 percent vacant, the CWB said.
Railcar unloadings exceeded targets at all Canadian ports.

Vancouver hopper car unloadings totalled 3,189 compared to the target of 2,720. Unloadings at Prince Rupert totalled 1,393 compared to the target of 1,200. Thunder Bay unloadings totalled 2,387 compared to the target of 2,300.
Grain movement was virtually unhampered by this weekend's blizzard in Manitoba, the CWB said.
